name: Ankhura

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Ankhura for three nights in October, 2007, and had the most amazing experience we've ever had at a B&B. We were in Italy for our honeymoon, and Ankhura was the perfect relaxing, romantic location anyone could hope for. The drive to Monterongraffoli, just outside of San Giovanni D'Asso, is gorgeous, and there is plenty of exploring to do in the area, especially if you have rented a car.
reviews.title: Ankhura...Peace and Quiet in the Tuscan Countryside
A Tiny Village with a Giant Treat
reviews.text: Upon arrival, Chris greeted us with a bottle of wine and homemade appetizers, which the three of us enjoyed on the back patio overlooking the valley below. It was this touch of hospitality—completely unexpected and totally genuine—that set the tone for our entire stay.

Our room was simple, clean, and heavenly. The two windows overlooked the valley below the B&B, and the soft bed was covered in fluffy white linens. Each room has its own bathroom with a huge natural stone-tiled shower and all of the modern amenities. Monterongraffoli is incredibly quiet.
reviews.title: Best B&B Experience

likes.liked: — Quality of service and activities offered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had arranged to go on the truffle hunt with Chris several weeks before we arrived in Italy, and I highly recommend it. The day started very early, at 5:30 a.m., with coffee and pastries in the kitchen. From there, we drove a short way from Monterongraffoli, where Luciano (the local truffle hunter) and his dogs, Ugo and Lea, were waiting for us. After that, the adventure began! We hiked through Tuscan forests following the dog's amazing noses, and found several white truffles, which is much more exciting than it seems when you realize how tiny they are, and how hard it must be to find even one. One exceptionally amazing truffle was the size of a small potato, and we learned that it could later be worth as much as $2000! After the hunt we had a picnic breakfast in the Tuscan countryside, complete with truffles, eggs, bread, meats and cheeses, and champagne. Absolutely wonderful!
reviews.title: A Great Experience

likes.liked: — Clean, comfortable, great hosts, location, quiet, great breakfast, plenty of parking

reviews.title: Excellent Tuscan Cooking
reviews.text: I had a wonderful 4 day stay at Ankhura. The surrounding hillside towns were convenient for day trips and Ankhura was an extremely comfortable and clean place to call home. I loved having a brand new private bathroom. We mostly ate breakfast and dinner on a lovely patio with a serene view. Also a great place to hang out, read or have a glass of wine. The hosts, Chris and Tina, were accomodating and easy going and are now my new friends. Chris is an excellent cook. Emphasis is on the freshest local ingredients and everything is made fresh. The cooking lessons were fun and delicious. I bought a pastamaker as soon as I returned home and have already made 2 of the 3 lesson dinners already (to rave reviews and with great ease). I have already recommended Ankhura to a few of my friends.

I stayed at Ankhura this past May for 5 nights. Ankhura is a wonderful small B&B set in a charming town in Southern Tuscany, south of Siena. The town is quaint and secluded with wonderful hiking paths, surrounded by olive groves, cypress trees, fields of poppies and vineyards. It’s also located close to larger towns and between two great centers for wine (Montalcino and Montepulciano), which makes Ankhura a great base for exploring Tuscany.
reviews.title: A gem in every way

reviews.text: Ankhura is a gem in every way. The B&B was an old parsonage that the owners, Chris and Tina, have lovingly renovated, and the work they put into it really shows. The house retains its lovely old stone exterior and charm, but the bedrooms, bathrooms, floors and kitchen are new, clean and gorgeous. They have decorated the B&B with a combination of beautiful Asian artifacts and oil paintings. The furniture in the rooms is simple, yet wonderfully comfortable and sleek.
reviews.title: A home away from home in the heart of Tuscany!
Truffles and Tuscany
reviews.text: Chris and Tina have truly international backgrounds, having lived on many different continents, but both were educated and worked in the United States. As a result, they speak English like natives. Chris also speaks Swedish and, from what I could tell, they are quite proficient in Italian as well.

reviews.text: We found Ankhura by chance from another savy Tripadvisor user. She stayed their only one day and wished she explored Tuscany from this central location vs. changing hotels.
reviews.title: Loved our stay at Ankhura. Close to wineries and truffle hunting.

likes.liked: — Location in Tuscany and activities available
likes.disliked: — Will be greater when they get the pool in

reviews.text: Ankhura was a a perfect vacation getway! The B&B is located about 10 miles from Montalcino in a small village called Monterongriffoli which is in San Giovanni d'Asso. This is a small village with maybe 7 houses and a Catholic church in the center. It was mostly ruins a few years ago but much investment is taking place. The Catholic Church is now under renovations as well.
reviews.title: highlight of our whole trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chris and Tina (the owners of the B&B) were so helpful. They purchased the home a few years back and renovated it entirely. They have nice rooms with windows and views. Also the rooms each have their own bathroom. They planned a few of our days which included Tuscan cooking lessons in their kitchen with Chris who trained in Siena, Truffle hunting with a truffle hunter and his wonderful little dog followup by brunch picnic on a Tuscan hillside, and private winery visits with Guelfo Magrini the author of Brunello di Montalcino guidebook who served as our driver/expert/translator.
reviews.title: Great Culinary Experience

likes.disliked: — What's not to like? They paid attention to everything...

reviews.text: On our winery tours with our guide we visited Bolsignano which is a small winery where they only speak Italian and Argiano which is a larger operation with a villa & church onsite. I recommend these two wineries.
reviews.title: Family-friendly in the heart of southern Tuscany!

likes.liked: — The hosts, who were very helpful before and during the visit
likes.disliked: — Couldn't take more dinners there due to cooking classes

reviews.text: Our cooking lessons on Tuscan cusine provided us the opportunity to learn to make ravoli. Something that we will do at home. The steak we had was the best meat we ever ate in Europe. (We have been to Europe a number of times and dined at some extremely nice places.)
reviews.title: Excellent trip

likes.disliked: — It was a long drive from Florence airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Tuscan countryside is more beautiful than any camera can capture and Ankhura was the perfect little place to stay in order to explore the area. Monterongriffoli is a small little town, if you can call it that. My wife was very skeptical when we first arrived. The area is extremely old and many of the buildings are abondoned. But once you step through the door at Ankhura, it is simply wonderful. The house has been restored beautifully and the view from the back is breathtaking. From the morning we stepped through the door Chris and Tina greeted us with a smile and it felt like we'd known them for years. They are very hospitable to say the least. Although we were there only a short time, it was a great time and we hope to go back soon.
reviews.title: Beautiful, peaceful, relaxing

reviews.text: We found Ankhura at the last minute during our trip to Italy and could not believe our good fortune in stumbling upon this B&B. We liked it so much we found a way to make it back to Ankhura for an additional night at the end of our trip.
reviews.title: Perfect Tuscan Experience

reviews.text: This experience was exactly what we were looking for in our visit to Tuscany. A gorgeous setting with unbelievable food that was off the beaten path. The decor of the house was very tasteful, but also comfortable. Chris and Tina also gave us wonderful local tips on how to explore the area. We also took the cooking classes and loved them. Of our 2 weeks in Italy, the food that Chris prepared for dinner was the most delicious. I would highly recommend this experience to anyone looking to experience Tuscany up close.
reviews.title: Highly recommended!

reviews.text: We stayed at Ankhura for 4 nights and took three evenings of cooking lessons. We were travelling with another couple. We all had a fantastic time - no complaints or issues what-so-ever! I would highly recommend staying here, especially if you are interested in cooking classes and visiting smaller villages in Tuscany. We are already planning our next visit to partake in the truffle season! We also went on a guided hike with a picnic lunch with Laura which was arranged by Chris. This was really interesting to learn about the area and manmade landscape. Chris also arranged a wine tour which I doubt we could have accomplished choosing such a fantastic winery (tour and tasting not to mention quality of product) ourselves. The photos submitted by others and on their website are reflective of what you can expect. Beautiful, clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Vacation of a lifetime
A Unique Experience
reviews.text: I have always dreamed of going to Tuscany for truffle season. I cannot imagine a better place to stay than Ankhura. Not only did we take a truffle cooking class -- which was nothing short of amazing -- but we actually got to go hunting with a real truffle hunger and truffle hounds. This truly was one of the most exciting experiences of my life. We also spent a day wine tasting with the expert on the Brunello di Montalcino. I also learned how to make pizza, pasta, focaccia, tomato and pesto sauce, pine nut tart, and many other things. Chris is a brilliant chef (he prepared some of the best meals I ate in Italy) and excellent teacher, and he arranged the wine tasting and truffle hunting excursions for us ahead of time. He and his wife, Tina are gracious and charming hosts, and the accomodations are luxurious while at the same time comfortable and relaxing. Best of all, I felt like I really experienced Tuscany -- its food, its people, and its culture.

description: This beautiful little bed & breakfast is located in a magical medieval hamlet just south of Siena making it an ideal place from which to explore central and southern Tuscany. The proprietors, Christopher and Tina, left corporate careers in New York to indulge their passion for Italian culture, food and wine. Ankhura offers cooking classes, wine tours and truffle hunts throughout the year.
